title: Harry Potter Characters Coming to â€˜Monopoly Go!â€™
description: Scopely will launch a collaboration between its mobile game â€œMonopoly Go!â€ and the Warner Bros. Discovery-owned Harry Potter film franchise on Dec.
body:
Scopely will launch a collaboration between its mobile game â€œMonopoly Go!â€ and the Warner Bros. Discovery-owned Harry Potter film franchise on Dec. 10, bringing characters, collectables, mini-games and more from the Wizarding World to an original and enchanting Monopoly adventure.

	Per the description for the in-game Harry Potter event: â€œWhen Mr. Monopoly goes through the portal to platform nine-and-three-quarters, he is transported to the Wizarding World, where the board becomes a landscape of familiar Harry Potter settings such as Gringotts Wizarding Bank, the Forbidden Forest and, of course, Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
	

	â€œAlong the way, he will encounter familiar faces, including Harry Potter himself as well as Ron Weasley, Hermione GrangerÂ andÂ Rubeus Hagrid. The cast of characters expands with a new sticker album, featuring 23 sets of characters and creatures from the franchise. Each set tells a story and some include surprise easter eggs from the books and films.â€


	Additional features for the limited-time in-game update include racing mini-games aboard Quidditch broomsticks and Gringotts carts, hidden collectable artifacts like the Sorcererâ€™s Stone and unlockable themed tokens, emojis, dice and shields so players can proudly display their Hogwarts houses. Seasonal maps like the Hogwarts Castle, Diagon Alley and a holiday-themed Hogsmeade Village will also be available.

	â€œIn bringing the world of Harry Potter into â€˜Monopoly Go!,â€™ our incredible team at Scopely set out to create something truly magical for our players,â€ Scopelyâ€™s president of games Victor Diaz-Roig said. â€œWe wanted fans to feel the excitement of stepping into Hogwarts and wandering Diagon Alley, all while enjoying the playful twists and social fun that make â€˜Monopoly Go!â€™ so special. Every detail was crafted to deliver a new kind of adventure in a way that feels unmistakably Harry Potter and undeniably â€˜Monopoly Go!â€™â€
	

	The collaboration comes as Warner Bros. Discovery is ramping up promotion for its new â€œHarry Potterâ€ series on HBO. The upcoming show is a retelling of the seven books by J.K. Rowling, which Warner Bros. initially adapted into eight films between 2001 and 2011. The new HBO series stars Dominic McLaughlin as the titular Boy Who Lived alongside a thorough ensemble cast of new and veteran actors. It is currently filming its first season in the U.K. and is expected to release in 2027.

	The Harry Potter-themed edition of â€œMonopoly Go!â€ will be available Dec. 10 through Feb 4. as a free download onÂ iOS and Android.

	Watch the trailer for the new update below.

schema.headline: Harry Potter Characters Coming to â€˜Monopoly Go!â€™

title: Paramount Skydanceâ€™s Latest Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Backed by Three Middle Eastern Wealth Funds
description: The second round of offers for all or part of Warner Bros. Discovery are in from Paramount Skydance, Netflix and Comcast. And the new, higher offer
body:
The second round of offers for all or part of Warner Bros. Discovery are in from Paramount Skydance, Netflix and Comcast. And the new, higher offer for all of WBD from David Ellisonâ€™s Paramount is backed in part by the sovereign wealth funds of Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Abu Dhabi, sources tell Variety.

	The dollar amounts of the higher bids submitted Dec. 1 from Paramount Skydance (which wants to buy all of Warner Bros. Discovery) or from Netflix and Comcast (which want only the Warner Bros. studios and streaming business, and not WBDâ€™s linear TV assets) could not be learned. Paramountâ€™s latest all-cash offer is still mostly backed by the Ellison family (that is, Oracle co-founder and billionaire Larry Ellison) and includes financing from RedBird Capital, Apollo Global Management and others. 
	

	In addition, the latest Paramount Skydance offer for all of WBD includes funding from Saudi Arabiaâ€™s Public Investment Fund (PIF), the Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) and the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), Variety confirmed. Bloomberg News previously reported that Paramountâ€™s latest offer included the involvement of unspecified â€œMiddle East funds.â€


	Sources familiar with the situation said the level of involvement of the three Arab wealth funds with Paramountâ€™s latest offer does not meet the threshold to require approval by CFIUS, the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, which is the U.S. governmentâ€™s interagency body that reviews foreign investments in U.S. businesses potential national security risks.

	Meanwhile, Netflixâ€™s higher second-round bid for Warner Bros., comprising HBO Max and the WB studios operations, was mostly cash, according to reports from Bloomberg and the Wall Street Journal. Comcast also entered a bid for Warner Bros., per the Journal. Netflix has told WBD that if its bid is successful, the streamer would honor Warner Bros.â€™s deals to distribute films in theaters â€” despite Netflixâ€™s historical opposition to theatrical releases â€” and to continue producing TV and movies for non-Netflix partners.
	

	Reps for Paramount Skydance and Netflix declined to comment. Warner Bros. Discovery and Comcast reps did not respond to requests for comment.

	Variety last month reported that Paramount Skydance was assembling a bid for WBD with the backing of the three Middle Eastern wealth funds. But the Paramount nonbinding bid of $24/share for all of Warner Bros. Discovery that Paramount Skydance submitted Nov. 20 did not involve the three Arab wealth funds, sources clarified.

	David Ellison had been scheduled to appear at the New York Timesâ€™ DealBook Summit on Wednesday, Dec. 3. However, with the bidding process for Warner Bros. Discovery in play, Ellison is now not expected to appear, although that could change, according to a source familiar with the situation.

	Whatâ€™s next? The Warner Bros. Discovery board committee formally vetting the M&A offers will now decide whether to go forward with one of the bidders and engage in a period of exclusive negotiations with that party, or whether to solicit additional proposals. WBD has been aiming to complete the process by the end of 2025. 

	The M&A review kicked off in earnest last month, when Warner Bros. Discovery announced that it had received in-bound acquisition interest from multiple parties. The company said it will consider proposals in which the Warner Bros. business (HBO Max and studios) is sold separately from Discovery Global, the TV-centric company, which aligns with Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s already-underway plan to split into two companies by April 2026.

	Paramount Skydance chairman and CEO David Ellison previously submitted three bids for WBD but the Warner Bros. Discovery board rejected his previous highest offer of $23.50/share, comprising 80% cash and 20% stock. In his previous bids, Ellison had proposed offering WBD chief David Zaslav a co-chairman and co-CEO role in a merged Paramount Skydance-WBD; itâ€™s not known if thatâ€™s still on the table in Paramountâ€™s latest offer.

	Itâ€™s possible the board of Warner Bros. Discovery will decide to reject the M&A offers and stick to the companyâ€™s previous plan of splitting itself into two pieces: Warner Bros., led by Zaslav as CEO; and Discovery Global, headed by current CFO Gunnar Wiedenfels.

schema.headline: Paramount Skydanceâ€™s Latest Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Backed by Three Middle Eastern Wealth Funds

title: Nicholas Hoult and Daisy Edgar-Jones to Star in Disney+ Comedy Series â€˜Mosquitoâ€™ From â€˜The Greatâ€™ Writer Tony McNamara
description: Nicholas Hoult and Daisy Edgar-Jones are teaming up with â€œThe Greatâ€ and â€œPoor Thingsâ€ scribe Tony McNamara for a new Disney+ comedy series titled â€œ
body:
Nicholas Hoult and Daisy Edgar-Jones are teaming up with â€œThe Greatâ€ and â€œPoor Thingsâ€ scribe Tony McNamara for a new Disney+ comedy series titled â€œMosquito.â€

	Described as a â€œsardonic look at a young coupleâ€™s relationship,â€ the British stars play Kate and Ed, a â€œrecently married couple whose secrets begin to reveal as daily life chips away at the personas they presentâ€¦ all started by an intrusive mosquito,â€ according to the showâ€™s synopsis. Filming is set to begin next year.
	

	A Hulu original series from the U.K., â€œMosquitoâ€ marks a reunion for Hoult and McNamaraâ€™s after the success of â€œThe Great,â€ which ran for three seasons on the streamer. â€œIâ€™m thrilled and excited to work with and team up two of the best actors around,â€ McNamara said in a statement. â€œI canâ€™t wait to go make absurd comedy with them.â€


	Eric Schrier, president of Disney Television Studios and global original television strategy at The Walt Disney Company, and Angela Jain, head of content at Disney+ EMEA, added: â€œTony is one of the most talented writers working in film and television today, with a legacy of incredible success at Disney.Â He has an unmatched ability to bring fascinating and complex stories to life weaving sharply written, intricate dialogue with signature dark humor and complexity. Partnering with him on â€˜Mosquitoâ€™ is an incredible step forward for our local original content and reinforces our ambitions in the U.K.â€

	â€œMosquitoâ€ is produced by 20th Television, Piggy Ate Roast Beef Productions and Hustle & Punch and is executive produced by McNamara, Hoult, Edgar-Jones, Marian Macgowan, Tracy Underwood and Daniel Pipski. The series was commissioned for Disney+ by Lee Mason, executive director of scripted at The Walt Disney Company EMEA. The show will stream on Disney+ and Hulu globally.
	

	Deadline Hollywood was first to report the news.

schema.headline: Nicholas Hoult and Daisy Edgar-Jones to Star in Disney+ Comedy Series â€˜Mosquitoâ€™ From â€˜The Greatâ€™ Writer Tony McNamara

title: â€˜Stranger Thingsâ€™ Finale: Netflix Reveals 500+ Movie Theater Locations and Sets Runtime at 2 Hours and 5 Minutes
description:
The end is near for â€œStranger Things.â€ Netflix has confirmed the theater locations that will screen the series finale. 

	Per the streamer, the fina
body:
The end is near for â€œStranger Things.â€ Netflix has confirmed the theater locations that will screen the series finale. 

	Per the streamer, the finale of the global hit series will screen in over 500 theaters across the U.S. and Canada starting Dec. 31 at 5 p.m. PT and run through Jan. 1, 2026. Netflix has also officially confirmed the finaleâ€™s runtime at 2 hours and 5 minutes. 

	The full list of participating theater locations can be found at www.st5finale.com, which also contains instructions on how to RSVP. Tickets will not be sold for the screenings, but rather exhibitors will sell concession vouchers that will guarantee fans a seat at a screening. Thus, the theater owners will keep the revenue from the screenings. Netflixâ€™s owned-theaters are not selling tickets or concession vouchers, but fans can sign up via the RSVP list. 
	

	The news that the series finale would screen in theaters was first announced in October, after the Duffer brothers had expressed their desire to see that happen in a cover story interview with Variety. Netflix chief content officer Bela Bajaria had originally said that was not going to happen, but changed course after fans expressed a very strong desire to see the finale on the big screen. 


	While Netflix has put select movies into theaters over the years, this will be the first time they are doing so without recouping any box office returns. 

	The first four episodes of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 5 is now available. The next three episodes will drop on Dec. 25, with the finale dropping on Netflix and in theaters on Dec. 31.  
	

	â€œStranger Thingsâ€ is one of the most popular Netflix shows of all time. As the streamer previously announced, all four previous seasons re-entered the Top 10 list prior to the launch of Season 5, marking the first time a series had four previous seasons on the list at the same time.

schema.headline: â€˜Stranger Thingsâ€™ Finale: Netflix Reveals 500+ Movie Theater Locations and Sets Runtime at 2 Hours and 5 Minutes

title: CarÃ­n LeÃ³n Signs Global Deal With WME (EXCLUSIVE)
description: CarÃ­n LeÃ³n has signed a new deal WME for representation across all areas, led by Global Co-Head of Music Kirk M. Sommer. Together with manager Jorge
body:
CarÃ­n LeÃ³n has signed a new deal WME for representation across all areas, led by Global Co-Head of Music Kirk M. Sommer. Together with manager Jorge Juarez, Sommer intends to grow LeÃ³nâ€™s business and presence in territories beyond his current base.

	A five-time Grammy award and Latin Grammy award winner, LeÃ³n is a touring powerhouse. He is the first Latin artist ever to play Coachella and Stagecoach in the same year. He is also the first Latin artist to play the Sphere, with a run of seven appearances set for next year.
	

	Juarez added, â€œCarÃ­n has tremendous potential to expand into other global territories. We are looking to WME to lead the way in all areas of their expertise.â€ 


	LeÃ³n took home a Latin Grammy award at this monthâ€™s ceremony in Las Vegas for â€œPalabra De Toâ€™s (Seca)â€ which was named best contemporary Mexican music album. â€œPalabra De Toâ€™s (Seca)â€ is also up for a 2026 Grammy Award for best mÃºsica mexicana album.

	â€œCarÃ­n is a generational artist,â€ said Sommer. â€œIn his incredible career, he has consistently broken barriers and transcended genres. We are determined to bring the full weight of WME to bear to expand CarÃ­nâ€™s fanbase around the world and we are honored to work with both CarÃ­n and Jorge.â€

	Originally from Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico, LeÃ³n embarked on his musical journey at the age of 15. His debut album, â€œDesvelada con Banda y Mariachiâ€ in 2018, propelled him to fame. In September, LeÃ³n earned a chart-topping single with â€œMe EstÃ¡ Doliendo,â€ a collaborative ballad with Alejandro FernÃ¡ndez.

schema.headline: CarÃ­n LeÃ³n Signs Global Deal With WME (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Sabrina Carpenter Slams Trumpâ€™s White House for Using â€˜Junoâ€™ in ICE Raids Video: â€˜Evil and Disgustingâ€¦ Do Not Involve Me in Your Inhumane Agendaâ€™
description: Sabrina Carpenter slammed Donald Trumpâ€˜s White House for using her hit song â€œJunoâ€ in a video montage depicting ICE raids. The Grammy responded to t
body:
Sabrina Carpenter slammed Donald Trumpâ€˜s White House for using her hit song â€œJunoâ€ in a video montage depicting ICE raids. The Grammy responded to the video on X with the following takedown: â€œThis video is evil and disgusting. Do not ever involve me or my music to benefit your inhumane agenda.â€

	The White House has made a habit out of using pop songs from anti-Trump singers in videos praising Trump or celebrating ICE on social media. The latest video takes the most viral lyric from Carpenterâ€™s â€œJunoâ€ (when the singer asks about sex positions: â€œHave you ever tried this one?â€) and layers it over people being handcuffed, tackled and more by ICE agents. 
	

	Prior to The White House co-opting Carpenterâ€™s music for its ICE agenda, it did the same with her friend and collaborator Taylor Swift. A video that dropped in November used Swiftâ€™s â€œThe Fate of Opheliaâ€ in a montage celebrating Trump despite the U.S. presidentâ€™s frequent social media posts bashing Swift. The pop star did not comment on the video.


	Kenny Loggins made headlines in October for bashing The White Houseâ€™s use of his hit song â€œDanger Zoneâ€ in a video that depicted Trump flying over No Kings protestors and dropping poop all over them.

	â€œThis is an unauthorized use of my performance of â€˜Danger Zone.â€™ Nobody asked me for my permission, which I would have denied, and I request that my recording on this video is removed immediately,â€ Loggins said in a statement shared withÂ VarietyÂ at the time. â€œI canâ€™t imagine why anybody would want their music used or associated with something created with the sole purpose of dividing us. Too many people are trying to tear us apart, and we need to find new ways to come together.â€
	

	British pop singerÂ Jess GlynneÂ was more blunt over the summer when The White House used the â€œHold My Handâ€ Jet2holidays viral meme to promote ICE raids. She posted on social media: â€œThis post honestly makes me sick. My music is about love, unity, and spreading positivity â€” never about division or hate.â€

	Check out Carpenterâ€™s post below.

this video is evil and disgusting. Do not ever involve me or my music to benefit your inhumane agenda.â€” Sabrina Carpenter (@SabrinaAnnLynn) December 2, 2025

schema.headline: Sabrina Carpenter Slams Trumpâ€™s White House for Using â€˜Junoâ€™ in ICE Raids Video: â€˜Evil and Disgustingâ€¦ Do Not Involve Me in Your Inhumane Agendaâ€™

title: Spanish Screenings on Tour Touches Down at Ventana Sur
description: The itinerant Spanish Screenings on Tour will make a splash Dec. 4 returning to Buenos Airesâ€™ Ventana Sur, Latin Americaâ€™s most important mart-meet.
body:
The itinerant Spanish Screenings on Tour will make a splash Dec. 4 returning to Buenos Airesâ€™ Ventana Sur, Latin Americaâ€™s most important mart-meet.Â 

	Proving in the past a significant promotion platform for Spanish movies, Spanish Screenings on Tour, the 4th edition, organised by the MÃ¡laga Film Festival, is also a succinct exposition in its panel subjects of many of the drivers these days of international business: New talent, theatrical success, sales, co-production and IP.
	

	The morning of Dec. 4 is kicked off by the winners of the Malaga Festivalâ€™s Hack Malaga which features next gen content creators presenting innovative visions, using the latest audiovisual technologies.


	This is followed by presentations of clips from 2026 lineups from Spainâ€™s most prominent movie sales companies: Latido Films, Filmax, Film Factory, Bendita Film Sales, Sideral, Begin Again Films and Cinema Republic.

	Focusing on creating films which not only attracts soft-money finance but also returns, including from box office, an early afternoon session will see producer MarÃ­a Luisa GutiÃ©rrez of Bowfinger Intl. Pictures, one of the most successful production companies in Spain founded by GutiÃ©rrez and wildly popular actor-producer-director Santiago Segura, will discuss the â€œBowfinger Methodâ€ with Variety International Features Editor John Hopewell.Â 

	Bowfinger has catalog of 40-plus titles, including itsâ€œTorrenteâ€ and â€œFather There is Only Oneâ€ hit franchises, but also other titles not powered by Segura as a talent, such as 2024 breakout ETA infiltrator thriller â€œUndercover,â€ directed by Arantxa EchevarrÃ­a, which has scored an extraordinary â‚¬9.6 million ($11.2 million), making it the second-highest Spanish release of 2024. â€œUndercoverâ€ is also hailed as the biggest hit ever directed by a Spanish woman.Â  Â  Â 
	

	GutiÃ©rrez and AgustÃ­n Bossi at Buenos Airesâ€™ Pampa Films, behind â€œChinese Takeawayâ€ (2011) and in TV, â€œMonzÃ³nâ€ and â€œThe Boss,â€ both with Disney, will then drill down on case studies of Argentina-Spain co-production hits, which include the highest-grossing local movies in both Argentina â€“ â€œHomo sapiens!â€ â€“ and Mexico: â€œMesa de Regalos,â€ both involving Pampa The producers will also discuss what co-production brings to the table.Â 

	Two workshops held concurrently aim to delve into the issues of IP protection, one led by director-writer-lawyer Francisco MenÃ©ndez (â€œStealing Las Vegasâ€), and the other on strategic IP development, moderated by producer Sydney Borjas (â€œRed Queenâ€). Each workshop will dissect five case studies, MenÃ©ndez focusing on IP protection and Borjas on IP development.

	Spanish Screenings on Tour is backed by the Malaga Film Festival and the Spanish governmentâ€™s Institute of Cinematography and Audiovisual Arts as well as ICEX Spain Trade and Investment and the European Unionâ€™s NextGenerationEU.  

	The Spanish Screenings will climax with the announcement of projects at the Malaga Festivalâ€™s 2026 MÃ¡laga Fund & Co-Production Event (MAFF). Focusing on titles from Latin America, Spain and Portugal, MAFF, now gearing up for its 9th edition, has proved one of the centerpiece industry events at MÃ¡laga. Handling the presentation are Camilo VÃ¡zquez, deputy director general for international promotion and international Relations at Spainâ€™s ICAA, Ventana Sur Executive Director Ralph Haiek and MÃ¡laga Festival Director Juan Antonio Vigar.

	Co-organized by Cannes MarchÃ© du Film â€“ Cannes Film Festival, Argentinaâ€™s INCAA film-TV agency and its Uruguayan counterpart, ACAU, Ventana Sur runs Dec.1-5.Â  It was held in Montevideo, Uruguay last year as part of a plan to alternate venues between the two cities.

schema.headline: Spanish Screenings on Tour Touches Down at Ventana Sur

title: Megan Moroney, RosÃ©, BigXThaPlug, Role Model, Fuerza Regida, and Addison Rae, Elvira Anderfjard and Luka Kloser to Be Honored at Variety Hitmakers 2025
description: Variety has announced the final eight honorees for its ninth annual Hitmakers celebration. Spanning a wide range of musical genres and experience, a
body: Variety has announced the final eight honorees for its ninth annual Hitmakers celebration. Spanning a wide range of musical genres and experience, all recipients are being recognized for their breakthrough success over the past year. In no particular order, they are:Â Â Megan Moroney â€” Storyteller of the YearÂ RosÃ© â€” Global Hitmaker of the YearÂ Addison Rae, Elvira AnderfjÃ¤rd, Luka Kloser â€” The Future Is Female AwardÂ BigXThaPlug â€” Hip-Hop Disruptor of the YearÂ Role Model â€” Triple Threat of the YearÂ Fuerza Regida â€” Humanitarians of the YearBig Loud: Seth England, Joey Moi, Craig Wiseman â€” Platinum Decade AwardÂ Elliot Grainge â€” Executive of the YearÂ Â The above honorees will join previously announced Hitmaker of the Year Sabrina Carpenter, and previously announced honorees Tate McRae, Buddy Guy, Alex Warren, the MarÃ­as; EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI (the singing voices of HUNTR/X); Sounwave, Mustard and Jack Antonoff; Republic Records and Riot Games.Â Presenters at the event include 2024 Hitmakers honoree Laufey, â€œSinnersâ€ co-star Miles Caton, comedian Jake Shane, multiplatinum producer-songwriters Jimmy Jam and Benny Blanco, and more. Â Â â€œWeâ€™re honored to highlight some of the artists and executives who have made the biggest impact over the past year,â€ said Varietyâ€™s executive music editor Jem Aswad.â€¯ â€œMegan Moroney for her storytelling on her stellar album â€œAm I Okay?â€; RosÃ© for her smash album and single with Bruno Mars, â€œAPT.â€; BigXThaPlug for his groundbreaking hip-hop/country fusion; and Role Model for his achievements in music and film â€” they are among the major breakthrough artists of 2025. So is Addison Rae, who is being recognized, along with collaborators Elvira AnderfjÃ¤rd and Luka Kloser, with The Future Is Female Award for breaking the glass ceiling by writing, producing and performing her Grammy-nominated debut album entirely themselves.Â Â â€œWe are also honored to recognize Los Angeles quartet Fuerza Regida not only for their music but for their humanitarian efforts, which include immigration reform, L.A. wildfire relief, scholarships, Latino community service and more.Â Â â€œFinally, we tip our collective Stetson to Big Loud for their decade of blockbuster success with Morgan Wallen, Ernest, Hardy and many others; and Atlantic Music Group CEO Elliot Grainge for the companyâ€™s success in his remarkable first year in the job â€” which includes fellow Hitmakers 2025 honorees MarÃ­as, RosÃ©, and Alex Warren.â€Â Â The honorees will also be recognized in the accompanying website and magazine looking back on the year in music and acknowledging the writers, producers, publishers, managers and executives who helped make â€” and break â€” the 25 most-consumed songs of the year, as measured by Billboard and Luminate Charts.â€¯Â Â Hitmakers culminates with an invitation-only brunch held on Saturday, December 6, in Los Angeles.â€¯Â This yearâ€™s event sponsors include Premier Partner TikTok, who will celebrate the communities and trends that helped make the yearâ€™s top 25 songs achieve their hit status with a custom video installation. Additionally, TikTok is the presenting partner of two pre-Hitmakers episodes of Varietyâ€™s â€œBehind the Songâ€ series featuring Madison Beerâ€™s â€œbittersweetâ€ and Sombrâ€™s â€œBack to Friendsâ€ as well as Sabrina Carpenterâ€™s inaugural episode of the new video series â€œVarietyâ€™s Tour Diariesâ€ (out Dec. 3). Â Riot Games is a Premier Partner of the event, and Global Head of Music Maria Egan will accept the Hitmakers Interactive Music in Media Award. Premier Partner Cash App will sponsor a photo booth for guests to take home a snapshot from the event. Eternal Water will be the Official Water Partner and L-Acoustics will be the Official Audio Technology Partner. Dos Equis is the Official Beer Partner of the event. Johnnie Walker Black Label will be an Official Partner, providing signature cocktails including the Go Go Highball.Â Amazon Music, Atlantic Records, Avex Music, Columbia Records, The Recording Industry Association of America, Sony Music Nashville, Sony Music Publishing, SoundExchange, Spotify, Universal Music Group, Universal Music Publishing Group, Warner Music Group are all supporting partners.

schema.headline: Megan Moroney, RosÃ©, BigXThaPlug, Role Model, Fuerza Regida, and Addison Rae, Elvira Anderfjard and Luka Kloser to Be Honored at Variety Hitmakers 2025

title: â€˜Foster Dadeâ€™ Hulu Pilot Casts Jack Alldridge in Lead Role
description:
Jack Alldridge has been cast in the lead role of Huluâ€˜s â€œFoster Dadeâ€ pilot, Variety has learned. 

	Alldridge will appear alongside previously anno
body:
Jack Alldridge has been cast in the lead role of Huluâ€˜s â€œFoster Dadeâ€ pilot, Variety has learned. 

	Alldridge will appear alongside previously announced cast members Chloe East, Matt Bomer and Cameron Mann in the pilot, which is based on the Nash Jenkins novel â€œFoster Dade Explores the Cosmos.â€ It was originally picked up to pilot at Hulu in August. 

	The logline for the project describes it as â€œa sophisticated mystery set at an East Coast boarding school that explores privilege, scandal, sexuality, and masculinity amid the rise of social media, millennial anxiety and pharmaceuticals.â€ 
	

	The character of Foster Dade is described as â€œa lonely, anxious, ferocious reader who self-medicates and blogs at his psychologistâ€™s insistence. Possessed of a depth of soul he doesnâ€™t yet know what to do with, he aches to be liked, to fall in love, to be known in a way his fractured home life never allowed. He has no idea that his hunger for reinvention will place him at the center of the greatest scandal the school has ever seen and that his name will be whispered by Kennedy students for decades to come.â€

	Alldridge is a recent graduate of the Guildford School of Acting. He most recently appeared in the Netflix series â€œDeath by Lightningâ€ and appeared in the John Lewis Christmas commercial 2025. Up next, he will be seen in Season 15 of the popular drama â€œCall the Midwifeâ€ and in the BritBox/ITV1 series â€œThe Lady.â€ Both shows will release in 2026. 

	He is repped by Hatch, Anonymous Content and CAA. 

	â€œFoster Dadeâ€ is being written and executive produced by Greg Berlanti and Bash Doran. Sarah Schechter and Leigh London Redman of Berlanti Productions also executive produce along with Donald De Line of De Line Pictures, Robbie Rogers, and Jenkins. Daniel Minahan will direct the pilot. Warner Bros. Television, where Berlanti is under an overall deal, is the studio.
	

	â€We knew the titular character of Foster Dade would be the heart and soul of this show,â€ said Berlanti, Schechter, and Doran in a joint statement. â€œWe needed an actor that could embody the full range of emotion and toe the line between hero and anti-hero. After a worldwide search and seeing thousands of talented young actors we were lucky enough to find Jack Alldridge. Fresh out of drama school, Jack is an extraordinary talent. He has a bright future ahead and we are lucky to be a part of it.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Foster Dadeâ€™ Hulu Pilot Casts Jack Alldridge in Lead Role

title: TNA Wrestlingâ€™s â€˜Thursday Night Impactâ€™ to Air Weekly on AMC
description: The home of â€œThe Walking Deadâ€ and the TV adaptations of Anne Riceâ€™s Immortal Universe is about to become the U.S. destination for viewing TNA Wrest
body:
The home of â€œThe Walking Deadâ€ and the TV adaptations of Anne Riceâ€™s Immortal Universe is about to become the U.S. destination for viewing TNA Wrestling.

	AMC Networks and TNA Wrestling announced Tuesday they have set a multi-year agreement to bring TNAâ€™s flagship weekly television show, â€œThursday Night iMPACT!,â€ to AMC.

	Beginning Jan. 15 with a live show taped at the Curtis Culwell Center in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex, AMC will feature â€œThursday Night iMPACT!â€ as a two-hour block every Thursday from 9-11 p.m. ET. The program will also be available on AMC Networksâ€™ streamer AMC+.
	

	Tickets for the Jan. 15 show will go on sale Dec. 11 at 10 a.m. ET at tnawrestling.com. The ticket pre-sale will begin Dec. 9 at 10 a.m. ET.


	Later in January, TNA Wrestling will host shows in Albuquerque, New Mexico (in a nod to AMCâ€™s â€œBreaking Badâ€ and â€œBetter Call Saulâ€) on Jan. 22-23, 2026. Tickets for both Albuquerque shows, which will air on AMC, at Tingley Coliseum will also go on sale on Dec. 11.

	â€œTNAâ€™s impressive growth and success is driven by the stories, characters and non-stop action fans love,â€ AMC Networks chief content officer and president of AMC Studios Dan McDermott said. â€œWe put fans at the center of everything we do, and TNA has built its brand and its programming around that same dedication and focus. What a great opportunity to come together and make Thursday Night iMPACT! a dynamic and entertaining weekly event on AMC and AMC+ starting next month.â€

	TNA Wrestling president Carlos Silva added: â€œWe are super excited to bring the in-ring excitement, energy and drama of TNA Wrestling to AMC. TNA Wrestling heads into 2026 the hottest it has ever been â€“ with intense rivalries and a fan base that loves the TNA stars. We cannot wait to expand the TNA audience with our new partner, AMC Networks, which has such a long and storied history of serving passionate and engaged fans across so many shows and franchises, through this new media rights deal.â€
	

	Founded in 2002, TNA Wrestling is a subsidiary of Anthem Sports & Entertainment. TNA Wrestling has been the pro wrestling home for such industry legends as Hulk Hogan, Ric Flair, Sting, AJ Styles, Kurt Angle, Mick Foley, Kevin Nash and Mickie James, among others. The 2025-26 TNA roster features Jeff & Matt Hardy, Nic & Ryan Nemeth, TNA World Champion Frankie Kazarian, Mike Santana, Steve Maclin, Eddie Edwards, Brian Myers, Santino Marella, Mustafa Ali, Moose, Elijah, Eric Young, Tessa Blanchard, Ash By Elegance, and others.

	Watch the promo for TNA Wrestlingâ€™s â€œThursday Night Impactâ€ ahead of its move to AMC in the video below.

schema.headline: TNA Wrestlingâ€™s â€˜Thursday Night Impactâ€™ to Air Weekly on AMC

title: Gwendoline Christie Struggles to Get Into Cab With Massive Wig
body:
Gwendoline Christie
                          Root Awakening!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 2, 2025 8:15 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Gwendoline Christieâ€™s always serving high-fashion drama... but this time the drama fought back -- landing her in a hilariously hair-raising mess that nearly stalled her whole evening!
      
    
          Check out the pics from Sunday night -- the "Game of Thrones" queen arrived in a frizzy, larger-than-life blonde wig for the 2025 Fashion Awards... stunning on the red carpet, not so graceful when all 6-feet-3-inches of her (plus that amplified wig altitude) tried squeezing into a cab.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The wig was loud, wild, and doing the most... turning her attempt to get into a cab into a full-on operation.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Nonetheless, while the wig was perfect for a night of fashion and theatrics, she probably shouldâ€™ve planned a quick release solution option for the ride home -- 'cause that mane was not commuter-friendly.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Clearly, Gwendoline had high hopes for her evening... but that wig had absolutely zero chill!

title: Dave Coulier Reveals New Cancer Diagnosis, But Prognosis Is Positive
body:
Dave Coulier
                          Battling Cancer, Again
                      
                  
                        Published December 2, 2025 6:48 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    NBC
          
    
          "Full House" star Dave Coulier has been diagnosed with yet another type of cancer ... but he says early detection probably saved his life.
      
    
          The 66-year-old actor told "Today" he has p16 squamous carcinoma -- a cancer of the head and neck. This comes just months after he beat stage 3 non-Hodgkin Lymphoma -- a cancer of the blood.
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          He told host Craig Melvin the 2 illnesses have nothing to do with each other.
      

          Check out the video ... Dave details a routine PET scan in October that revealed the new condition. "I said to the doctors, â€˜Well, did this happen because of the lymphoma?â€™ And they said, â€˜Totally unrelated.â€™"
      
    
          Thankfully, Dave said the prognosis is good ... "It has a 90-plus curability rate. But the thing that has really saved my life is that early detection -- saved my life, not just the first time, but the second time as well. So I hope youâ€™re getting your check-ups."
      
    
          Dave has also dealt with cancer from the perspective of a concerned family member. He's lost his mother, a sister, and a niece to cancer.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          To help prevent other families from experiencing the same fate, he's created a digital marketplace called AwearMarket, which offers toxin-free, holistic products.

title: Texas Student Found Dead After A&M Football Game, Mom Suspects Foul Play
description:
Texas A&M Student
                          Body Found After Football Game
body:
Texas A&M Student
                          Body Found After Football Game
                          ... Mother Questions Police Narrative
                      
                  
                        Published December 2, 2025 7:28 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Brianna Aguilera -- a 19-year-old student at Texas A&M University -- was found dead near campus hours after a college football game ... and now her mother is searching for answers.
      
    
          According to San Antonio's KSAT-TV, Brianna was at Texas A&M's football game against the University of Texas in Austin Friday night ... hours later, a bystander found her body outside a campus apartment complex.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Brianna's mother, Stephanie Rodriguez, told KSAT she's not satisfied with answers she's gotten from the Austin Police Department. She said her daughter stopped answering her phone after the game, though she could see it pinging in Austin. Brianna was found about 1 AM Saturday ... Rodriguez was informed by police at 4 PM her daughter's body was in the morgue.
      

          Investigators believe Brianna killed herself by jumping from the 17th floor of an apartment building ... but her mother insists Brianna was not suicidal, and was looking forward to becoming a lawyer.
      
    
          Rodriguez said she thinks at least one of the 15 people reportedly in the apartment around the time of her daughter's death must have some knowledge about what went down.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Rodriguez told KSAT ... â€œThere was a fight that happened between my daughter and another girl, and they were all staying in the same apartment that I have actual text messages of, and the detective just disregarded them.â€
      
    
          A school spokesperson told KSAT the university â€œdoes not have a statement to share at this time.â€ The cause of death will ultimately be determined by the Travis County Medical Examiner's Office ... her death is currently not considered a homicide.
      
    
          If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chat 988lifeline.org.
